question.title: NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/poi/logging/PoiLogManager
question.body:
Here's an error when using poi-tl:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/poi/logging/PoiLogManager
    at org.apache.poi.ooxml.POIXMLDocumentPart.<clinit>(POIXMLDocumentPart.java:56)
    at com.deepoove.poi.XWPFTemplate.compile(XWPFTemplate.java:164)
    at com.deepoove.poi.XWPFTemplate.compile(XWPFTemplate.java:132)
    at com.deepoove.poi.XWPFTemplate.compile(XWPFTemplate.java:89)
    at com.deepoove.poi.XWPFTemplate.compile(XWPFTemplate.java:79)
    at com.example.springbootbackendedusys.utils.TemplateGenerator.main(TemplateGenerator.java:152)
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.apache.poi.logging.PoiLogManager
    at java.base/jdk.internal.loader.BuiltinClassLoader.loadClass(BuiltinClassLoader.java:641)
    at java.base/jdk.internal.loader.ClassLoaders$AppClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoaders.java:188)
    at java.base/java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:520)
    ... 6 more

I use maven and have included the following dependencies.

<dependency>
      <groupId>com.deepoove</groupId>
      <artifactId>poi-tl</artifactId>
      <version>1.12.2</version>
    </dependency>

    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.apache.poi</groupId>
      <artifactId>poi</artifactId>
      <version>5.2.2</version>
    </dependency>

    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.apache.poi</groupId>
      <artifactId>poi-ooxml</artifactId>
      <version>5.2.2</version>
    </dependency>

    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.apache.poi</groupId>
      <artifactId>poi-ooxml-schemas</artifactId>
      <version>4.1.2</version>
    </dependency>

How to fix the problem help. It looks like something missing,I have tried to rebuild and download dependencies but not help.

answers.body:
5.4.1 definitely has the class you are looking for .. try upping to this version

<dependency>
    <groupId>org.apache.poi</groupId>
    <artifactId>poi-ooxml</artifactId>
    <version>5.4.1</version>
</dependency>
<dependency>
    <groupId>org.apache.poi</groupId>
    <artifactId>poi</artifactId>
    <version>5.4.1</version>
</dependency>

You're encountering this error:

NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/poi/logging/PoiLogManager

because the class org.apache.poi.logging.PoiLogManager was introduced in Apache POI 5.2.3. However, your project is using POI 5.2.2, which does not contain this class.

Your poi-tl version (1.12.2) depends on POI 5.2.3+, so this mismatch leads to the runtime exception.

Update all your Apache POI dependencies to at least 5.2.3 to match what poi-tl requires:

<dependency>
    <groupId>com.deepoove</groupId>
    <artifactId>poi-tl</artifactId>
    <version>1.12.2</version>
</dependency>

<dependency>
    <groupId>org.apache.poi</groupId>
    <artifactId>poi</artifactId>
    <version>5.2.3</version>
</dependency>

<dependency>
    <groupId>org.apache.poi</groupId>
    <artifactId>poi-ooxml</artifactId>
    <version>5.2.3</version>
</dependency>

<dependency>
    <groupId>org.apache.poi</groupId>
    <artifactId>poi-ooxml-lite</artifactId>
    <version>5.2.3</version>
</dependency>

See also Component Overview: Component Map.

question_comments.body: I use maven for compilation and running,the problem occurs when calling XWPFTemplate.compile
Please clarify your specific problem or provide additional details to highlight exactly what you need. As it's currently written, it's hard to tell exactly what you're asking.

79700446.body: can you correct this? poi-ooxml-lite not poi-ooxml-schemas - poi-ooxml-schemas was replaced by poi-ooxml-lite in POI 5.0.0
Really thank you, but I tried the method you mentioned, the same error still occurred
